title: Understanding Reinforcement Learning Frameworks for Patient-Centered Dynamic Treatment Planning: An Integrated Approach to Medical Ethics, Social Systems, and Civic Rights

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of healthcare systems, data security concepts, foundational machine learning (including reinforcement learning), basic knowledge of medical ethics and patient rights, introductory understanding of social equity and public policy
context.additional_context: In smartphone-based accessible environments, this course explores reinforcement learning applications considering medical data security. It integrates case studies that address the interaction between healthcare services and social systems (political, economic, cultural contexts), citizen rights protection, and fairness in medical resource distribution. It seeks practical implementation plans reflecting community characteristics and institutional constraints.

learning_goals: Explain the principles of reinforcement learning frameworks that enable the development of dynamic treatment plans while complying with patient privacy protection, medical ethics, and social equity considerations
Analyze security requirements for healthcare decision models using encrypted health data and social responsibility requirements (protection of civil rights, fairness in resource allocation)
Design patient-centered treatment plan simulation tools implementable in resource-limited settings, considering integration with healthcare systems, political frameworks, and cultural diversity

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
